sentences.english: Police said she suffered only slight injuries from the traffic accident, including a small fracture to her left leg.
sentences.chinese: 警察说她在车祸中只受到轻伤，包括左腿轻微骨折。

sentences.english: A third person suffered minor lacerations , Mr. Etter said.
sentences.chinese: 据报导，另有一人受轻伤。

sentences.english: If you've got light injuries and you need bandages or aspirins , you'll get seen.
sentences.chinese: 如果你碰到轻伤和你需要绷带或阿司匹林，你将被看。

sentences.english: Chamberlain was slightly wounded in the foot at th at battle by a spent bullet.
sentences.chinese: 在此战中，张伯伦被一颗冲力已尽的子弹轻伤足部。

sentences.english: Be that case of the probationer causing somebody slight wound case.
sentences.chinese: 即某市公安局刑侦大队实习生李某致人轻伤案。

sentences.english: Even a minor injury can be life- threat ening.
sentences.chinese: 即使轻伤也会对生命构成威胁。

sentences.english: Lastly, the greatly-wound little boy was sent to the central hospital in the city.
sentences.chinese: 最后受轻伤的小男孩被送到市中心医院。

sentences.english: It's worth getting a small wound to be invalided home.
sentences.chinese: 能被遣送回国，受点轻伤也值得的。

sentences.english: Even a minor injury can be life-threatening.
sentences.chinese: 即使轻伤也会对生命构成威胁。

sentences.english: The badly wounded take priority for medical attention over those only slightly hurt.
sentences.chinese: 重伤人员比轻伤人员尽先得到治疗。

sentences.english: Two others were slashed as they wrestled the shooter to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 另外两人在与枪手扭打在地的过程中受了些轻伤。

sentences.english: Accidents and small injuries are an everyday occurences in this job.
sentences.chinese: 这项工作中，事故和轻伤是每天发生的事。

sentences.english: Brandy was subbed soon after scoring due to a minor ankle injury.
sentences.chinese: 布兰迪在进球后不久，因脚踝轻伤被换下场。

sentences.english: He said he was lightly wounded in the attack on his compound, adding that seven people had been killed.
sentences.chinese: 他说，他在总统府遇袭时受轻伤，另外有七人遇难。

sentences.english: The 30 people suffered light injuries and were treated in hospital.
sentences.chinese: 受伤的30人都受了轻伤，在医院接受治疗。

definition: to abrade/to scrape/to chafe/to graze/abrasion/friction burn/scratch
to sustain injuries/wounded (in an accident etc)/harmed
to be wounded/to sustain an injury
to wound with a blade or hatchet/to slash/to gash
